intro: Spermacoce hookeri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Africa and is characterized by its striking white, night-blooming flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often growing in open woodlands or disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an attractive ornamental plant, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
